newsitem.title: MALTA: Palestinians says Arafat will not meet Levy.
newsitem.headline: Palestinians says Arafat will not meet Levy.

text.p: European efforts to bring Palestinan President Yasser Arafat and Israeli Foreign Minister David Levy together floundered on Tuesday despite intensive negotiations, Palestinian officials said.
The EU had hoped to bring Arafat and Levy together to discuss the Middle East peace crisis on the fringes of a Malta conference.

"The chances of a meeting between Mr Levy and the president almost do not exist. The president is not going to meet with Mr Levy because of certain issues that need to be discussed," Arafat spokesman Marwan Kanafani told Reuters.
Kanafani said even a meeting between Levy and a Palestinian minister now looked unlikely.
"There was a quasi-agreement that Levy would meet a Palestinian minister. The president authorised a meeting. Now there has been a retraction on this position," he said.

Earlier, Palestinian Planning Minister Nabil Shaath said he would meet Levy. In his speech to the Malta conference, Levy urged the Palestinians to resume negotiations without conditions but diplomats say the Palestinians are pressing for an Israeli gesture, especially on the settlement in East Jerusalem.
